marketNews.title: Issuer Performance Compilation 2024: Part 1
marketNews.content: Most issuers have announced their financial reports for the 2024 fiscal year. In this first part of the issuer performance compilation, we summarize the performance of issuers closely related to consumers, including the banking, consumer staples, dairy, poultry, retail, tobacco, healthcare, and media sectors. The following is a breakdown of revenue, operating profit, and net profit for each sector: Key Takeaway: In general, the performance of most consumer-related sectors was quite good in 4Q24 and throughout FY24, where the total top-line in both periods still grew above +6% YoY. Operating profit margins in 4Q24 and FY24 in total were also relatively stable, causing total operating profit to still grow +5.6% YoY in 4Q24 and +7.2% YoY throughout FY24. The decline in operating profit margins that occurred in the consumer staples, dairy, retail, and tobacco sectors during FY24 could be offset by increases in the banking and poultry sectors. Although top-line and operating profit recorded good performance, net profit in 4Q24 decreased by -1.6% YoY, mainly driven by exchange rate losses from consumer staples companies such as $ICBP accompanying the weakening rupiah exchange rate and increased provisions in several banks. However, total net profit throughout FY24 still grew quite well by +4.8% YoY, mainly driven by the banking, poultry, and dairy sectors. Highlights from the recap of issuer performance by industry include: Nominally, the banking sector remains the largest contributor to net profit growth during FY24. Growth in this sector was mainly driven by $BBCA (+13% YoY) and $NISP (+19% YoY), while net profit from the other 3 big banks only booked growth around +0-3% YoY. Throughout FY24, the banking sector recorded significant credit growth from BBCA and $BMRI, with both exceeding the FY24 guidance from their respective management. However, the surge in provisions from $BBRI became a negative aspect, making it the only big bank that recorded a worse cost of credit (CoC) compared to its management guidance. The poultry sector recorded the highest percentage YoY net profit growth during FY24. This was due to the decrease in the average price of raw materials (corn -5% YoY), as well as the maintained increase in DOC prices (+28% YoY) and broiler (+3% YoY) during FY24. Besides poultry, industries that recorded double-digit net profit growth during FY24 include media, healthcare, and dairy. Meanwhile, industries that recorded a decline in net profit were consumer staples (especially pressured by the decline in $UNVR performance) and tobacco (volume and margin decline due to excise tax increases and downtrading).

marketNews.title: Tax Office Extends Annual Tax Return Filing Deadline to April 11
marketNews.content: The Director at the Directorate General of Taxes, Ministry of Finance, Dwi Astuti, stated on Wednesday (26/3) that they are extending the deadline for filing annual tax returns (SPT) for individual taxpayers from March 31, 2025, to April 11, 2025. Dwi explained that this step was taken considering the long national holidays and collective leave for Nyepi and Eid al-Fitr 2025, specifically from March 25 to April 7, 2025.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo States Indonesia to Join BRICS New Development Bank
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto stated on Tuesday (25/3) that Indonesia will join the New Development Bank, a multilateral bank developed by BRICS member countries. President Prabowo claimed that Indonesia's accession as a member of the New Development Bank will help Indonesia accelerate its economic transformation. Former Brazilian President, Dilma Rousseff, mentioned that the New Development Bank is interested in collaborating in sectors such as renewable energy and biodiesel, as well as technology development. Rousseff also mentioned that President Prabowo has presented dozens of projects for potential partnerships with the New Development Bank.

tickerNews.title: BBNI: President Director Replaced, Dividend Distribution with Indication of 8.8% Yield
tickerNews.content: $BBNI: Shareholders of Bank Negara Indonesia on Wednesday (26/3) approved the proposed replacement of the Board of Directors and Commissioners, with Putrama Wahju Setyawan becoming the President Director replacing Royke Tumilaar, while Alexandra Askandar became the new Vice President Director. Putrama previously served as Vice President Director at BBNI, while Alexandra previously served as Vice President Director at Bank Mandiri ($BMRI). Furthermore, the AGM also approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 14 trillion rupiah or 374 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 8.8% as of Wednesday (26/3). This dividend amount is equivalent to a 65% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 50%), marking the highest dividend payout ratio in the company's history and above management guidance during the FY24 earnings call in the range of 50-60%. The cum-date and payment date for the dividend have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: BMRI: Bank Mandiri booked net profit of IDR 3.6 trillion in February 2025
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri reported (https://www.bankmandiri.co.id/documents/38265486/0/02+IR+Februari+2025+-+Format+New+SE+OJK+%281%29.pdf) net profit (bank only) of 3.6 trillion rupiah in February 2025 (+7.8% YoY, -11% MoM). This result caused the bank only net profit during 2M25 to reach 7.6 trillion rupiah (+6% YoY), higher than the consensus 2025F consolidated growth estimate at +3.5% YoY. Bank only Credit Cost (CoC) during 2M25 was relatively kept low at 0.68% (vs. 2M24: 0.88%), better than management's consolidated FY25 guidance targeting a range of 1-1.2%. Bank only credit growth reached +19.1% YoY in 2M25 (vs. 1M25: +19.3% YoY, 12M24: +20.7% YoY), continuing a gentler growth trend in line with management's consolidated FY25 guidance in the range of +10-12% YoY, with the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio realization dropping to 92.5% (vs. 12M24: 98.8%, 1M25: 93.7%). On the other hand, Net Interest Margin during 2M25 weakened to 4.21% (vs. 2M24: 4.52%), marking the lowest level since at least 1M22 and below management's consolidated FY25 guidance in the range of 5-5.2%.

tickerNews.title: GOTO: Grab reportedly seeks up to $2 billion loan for potential takeover
tickerNews.content: $GOTO: Bloomberg (https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-03-26/grab-seeks-up-to-2-billion-loan-for-potential-takeover-of-goto) reported that Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) is in talks to secure a loan of up to 2 billion US dollars to support a potential acquisition of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia. News regarding the plan to raise capital indicates that the deal is progressing, although GOTO declined to comment on the issue and Grab has not yet responded. Previously (https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/-bei-terapkan-trading-halt-pertama-kali-sejak-akhir-2020#:~:text=%24GOTO%3A%C2%A0Bloomberg,miliar%20dolar%20AS.), Bloomberg reported last week that Grab had commenced due diligence and was discussing the structure of a deal that could be valued at over 7 billion US dollars.

tickerNews.title: PNBN: DBS reportedly leading the race to buy a controlling stake
tickerNews.content: $PNBN: Reuters (https://www.reuters.com/markets/deals/dbs-leading-race-buy-controlling-stake-indonesias-panin-bank-sources-say-2025-03-26/) reported that DBS Group (SI: DBSM) is leading the race to buy a controlling stake in Bank Pan Indonesia, with the Singaporean bank reportedly competing with CIMB Group (KL: CIMB). Reuters sources said that around 86% of PNBN shares valued at 1.8 billion US dollars are ready to be sold, where this ownership portion is a combination of the ownership stakes from PNBN's controllers, the Gunawan family, and ANZ's ownership (AX: ANZ). The Gunawan family is reportedly flexible regarding the portion of shares to be sold and the amount will depend on the offer price. Reuters sources said that binding offers for the transaction will be due at the end of April or early May 2025, depending on market conditions, but bidders' decisions may still change.

tickerNews.title: BUKA: Bukalapak plans share buyback up to IDR 1.9 trillion
tickerNews.content: $BUKA: Bukalapak plans to conduct a share buyback with funds up to 1.9 trillion rupiah from March 26 to June 25, 2025. The company did not specify the number of shares to be repurchased in this corporate action. (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/866ebf2b6d_9b1fbdf5ab.pdf) This plan does not require AGM approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: CBDK: Bangun Kosambi Sukses plans share buyback up to IDR 1 trillion
tickerNews.content: $CBDK: Bangun Kosambi Sukses plans a share buyback up to 1 trillion rupiah from March 27 to June 26, 2025. The company did not specify the number of shares to be repurchased in this corporate action. (https://emitten-announcement.stockbit.com/attachments/f-31871416-0_CBDK_Laporan_Informasi_dan_Fakta_Material_31871416_lamp1.pdf) This plan does not require AGM approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: UNTR: United Tractors sold 435 Komatsu heavy equipment units in February 2025
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors reported (https://www.unitedtractors.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/UNTR-Monthly-Operational-Update-as-of-Feb-2025.pdf) sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 435 units in February 2025 (-19% MoM, +42% YoY). Cumulatively during 2M25, Komatsu sales reached 971 units (+18% YoY), equivalent to 21.1% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share dropping to 26% (vs. 1M25: 29%, 2M24: 30%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 21.5 million tons (+3.9% YoY) during 2M25, with overburden removal at 168.3 million bcm (-8.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTRO: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi increases stake in Petrosea
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 15.2 million shares of Petrosea at an average price of 2,419 rupiah per share on March 18-19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 37 billion rupiah. After (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/d327a43097_6b8f4ae9bd.pdf) this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership stake in PTRO increased from 44.234% to 44.385%.

tickerNews.title: MEDC: Medco Energi plans share buyback up to 1.62% of shares
tickerNews.content: $MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional plans a buyback of up to 407 million (1.62%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 820 billion rupiah from March 26 to June 25, 2025. (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/58aff95ab3_15669300c4.pdf) This plan does not require AGM approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. Previously, MEDC had completed its plan to buy back up to 100 million (0.398%) shares on March 24, 2025, (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202404/7bea747484_f4a0561f07.pdf) based on AGM approval on May 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTPP: PT PP records new contract value of IDR 2.9 trillion per February 2025
tickerNews.content: $PTPP: PT PP recorded (https://industri.kontan.co.id/news/ptpp-catat-nilai-kontrak-baru-rp-29-triliun-per-februari-2025) a new contract value of 2.9 trillion rupiah during 2M25 (-32% YoY). The Corporate Secretary of PTPP, Joko Raharjo, stated that this realization is equivalent to 8.79% of the 2025 target. New contract acquisitions during 2M25 came from the road and bridge sector (46.7%), buildings (37.63%), dams (9.34%), irrigation (5.94%), as well as oil and gas (0.4%).

tickerNews.title: EXCL: Merger effective date with Smartfren set for April 16, 2025, and dividend announced
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata ($EXCL) announced (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/11ded0373c_f08568aa2f.pdf) that the effective date for the business merger with Smartfren Telecom ($FREN) falls on April 16, 2025. EXCL shareholders who did not approve the plan in the EGM on Tuesday (25/3) were given the opportunity to sell their shares to the company at a price of 2,350 rupiah per share, with the submission of the share selling statement form no later than April 10, 2025, and payment no earlier than April 16, 2025. In a separate (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/62932bb3fa_a055a99f33.pdf) corporate action, EXCL will distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah or 85.7 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 3.8% as of Wednesday (26/3). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated markets is April 11, 2025, with payment on April 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SINI: Shareholder Batubara Development Pte. Ltd. reduces stake
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Singaraja Putra ($SINI), Batubara Development Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 72.2 million SINI shares at a price of 1,000 rupiah per share on March 25, 2025, to PT Autum Prima Indonesia and Hapsoro. The total transaction value reached approximately 72.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/a537a10317_0ca8fa81af.pdf), Batubara Development Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in SINI decreased from 31.22% to 16.22%, PT Autum Prima Indonesia's ownership increased from 30% to 36%, and Hapsoro's direct ownership increased from none previously to 9%.

tickerNews.title: PACK: Shareholder PT Benson Kapital Indonesia sells stake
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama ($PACK), PT Benson Kapital Indonesia, sold approximately 22.3 million PACK shares at a price of 89 rupiah per share on March 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah and was intended to realize investment gains. After (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/03c5b894f4_0b45e66531.pdf) this transaction, PT Benson Kapital Indonesia's ownership in PACK decreased from 5.9% to 4.5%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA: President Director Djauhar Maulidi purchases shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Rukun Raharja ($RAJA), Djauhar Maulidi, purchased 500,000 RAJA shares at an average price of 2,088 rupiah per share on March 20-21, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.1 billion rupiah. After (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/8be3c84579_a5f305e4c6.pdf) this transaction, Djauhar Maulidi's ownership in RAJA increased, but remained in the range of 0.001%.

tickerNews.title: ENRG: Plans CCS/CCUS development project at Arun Field, Aceh
tickerNews.content: $ENRG: Energi Mega Persada along with its subsidiary, PT Pema Global Energi, announced (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/d44d63e4e8_66223b4d03.pdf) plans for the development of a carbon capture and storage (CCS) and/or carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCUS) project in the Arun Field, Aceh. ENRG stated that the Arun field is considered one of the most potential CCS locations in Southeast Asia, with a carbon storage capacity approaching almost 16 trillion cubic feet. As an initial step, the company will conduct a comprehensive feasibility study targeted for completion in 2026.

tickerNews.title: NINE: Controlling shareholder will not exercise rights in rights issue
tickerNews.content: $NINE: Techno9 Indonesia stated in a (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/10399495e1_25e4473d10.pdf) clarification to the IDX that the controlling shareholder will not exercise its rights in the company's rights issue plan. NINE also explained that the company's controlling shareholder will change after (https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/bbca-2m25-laba-bersih-8-yoy#:~:text=Techno9%20Indonesia%C2%A0(%24NINE)%C2%A0berencana%20menggelar%20rights%20issue%20hingga%20~2%2C2%20miliar%20saham%20baru%C2%A0dengan%20efek%20dilusi%20hingga%2050%25.%20Harga%20pelaksanaan%20belum%20diumumkan%2C%20sementara%20perolehan%20dana%20akan%20digunakan%C2%A0untuk%20modal%20kerja.%20Rencana%20ini%C2%A0akan%20dibahas%20dalam%20RUPSLB%20pada%2030%20April%202025.) this corporate action is completed, although it did not elaborate further. Advance Opportunities Fund will act as standby buyer. NINE also mentioned that the rights issue plan assumes a 1:1 ratio with a maximum fund acquisition of 80 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BDMN: Bank Danamon to distribute 2024 fiscal year dividends
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon Indonesia ($BDMN) will distribute (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/1c672597c7_0533aac152.pdf) dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah or 113.85 rupiah per share. The cum-date in the regular and negotiated markets is April 9, 2025, with payment on April 24, 2025. Referring to the closing price of BDMN shares on Wednesday (26/3) at 2,400 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 4.7%.

tickerNews.title: ACST: Acset Indonusa plans rights issue up to 5 billion new shares
tickerNews.content: $ACST: Acset Indonusa plans to hold a rights issue of up to 5 billion (39%) new shares with a dilution effect of up to 28%. The implementation price has not been announced, while the fund acquisition is intended to support business activities, business/corporate development, and working capital. The company's controller, PT Karya Supra Perkasa, will act as the standby buyer in this corporate action. (https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202503/8903b2bc42_5e24f227b4.pdf) This plan will be discussed at the EGM on May 2, 2025.
